Headline: Founder & CSO | Gourmet Dry Fruits | Dog Dad | Sustainable Luxury | IIM-A
Comment: Passion may spark the venture, but recurrence pays the bills and conviction keeps both alive!

Headline: milliGOLD | RSR Innovations
Comment:
Long ago at Murugappa Group we were trained by Mercuri Goldman on Capital Equipment selling - and there was this "fox hunting" method of mapping gate keepers, influencers, users and decision makers and their relative outlook towards you and the competition and then using them to champion your cause - worked very well for us in large organizations and public sector enterprises.

It is long gestation process (we work the relationship over 3-5 years before we land an order, from creating a need to writing the tender specs). Precisely why startups should stay away, because you don't have such a luxury of years from planting teak and harvesting later.

Headline: Aligning Strategy, People & Delivery for Growth | 25+ Years Driving Brand & Business Outcomes | Calm Clarity, Lasting Impact
Comment:
Avik Ashar Loved this - where their SPOC left the company/was transferred etc and the deal went ALL THE WAY back to the beginning. Luckily for me, I was able to work with them when they moved to different organisations. Bless them for this. 

The most appealing part - when Founders are solving problems they've faced during their careers. I am working on solving - the biggest one to my knowledge is Closure, Client Retention.
